work_exp:
[u"Area Superintendent/co-owner/VP of operations & HSE
West, TX
Transportation Industry

I have over 15 years' experience in the transportation industry ranging
from over the road truck driver, owner operator, regional truck driver, truck pusher in the oilfield industry, driver manager VP of Sales and Marketing, area manager, operations manager and V.P of Operations. I also have a background in safety as well as serving as VP of Safety and Human Resources for a 125-truck service company. My initial job was to step in and completely rebuild their safety and HR departments, getting them up to state and federal standards and overseeing the process once it was implemented to make sure all departments adhered to the rule s and regulations. Six months into this job and I was audited by Texas DOT and FMCSA and passed with ease.

• STB Work-over Rig Company (Modern Exploration) o I was the operation's Manager including sales for STB work-over from Oct. 2012 until Oct. 2013 when I started at FCTW. My duties were to hire and terminate employees as needed, take care of the HR paper work, oversee the drug program, schedule the rigs for various jobs as well as see after
the day to day operations of the company including setting up checks and balances for spending and increasing business by adding new customers. I reported directly to the owner.

• Green Energy Oil Field Services I was hired to establish business in the South Texas (Eagle Ford) area, open a trucking yard with vacuum trucks and frac tanks and build the business in South Texas. This job was to take an idea and grow it into a multi-million dollar a month operation by assembling the right sales team as well as manning the business with key personal in operations, HR and safety. I successfully opened two yards, one in Asherton and one in Gonzales TX. I was promoted to V.P. of Operations and over seen both yards. I had a fleet of 70 liquid natural gas trucks, the first in the area, introduced this technology in to the oilfield and had great success with it. The cost savings in fuel and reduction in emissions was a huge interest to the oil companies that we worked for. I also managed a fleet of over 500 frac, acid and mud tanks on our rental fleet. It was ultimately my job to make sure all HR and DOT regulations were followed each day as well as continuing safety training weekly and monthly.

• Dillon Transport. I was hired by Dillon Transport out of Chicago IL to put them in the oil and gas industry business. I was their VP of operations over the oilfield division which was a new area of operations for Dillon. I began by specking out and rigging a fleet of 33 vacuum trucks and establish their presence in the oilfield. I started with two new trucks and built the fleet to 35.
In seven months we averaged 22 trucks per day working and generating over a million dollars a month in revenue. I established a rental fleet of equipment which increased our revenue and created even more work for our trucks. I managed an office staff of 5, 3 sales people and 30+ drivers. It was also my ultimate responsibility to oversee the HR and safety departments and review their internal audits and look for any weakness and address them. When this venture started my office was the front seat of my pickup and in no time, we were 33 trucks strong, revenues of over a million a month with EBITDA greater than 25%.
• Premier Tank Truck Services o I was the General Manager of Premier Tank Truck Service out of York Town where I run a fleet of 13 trucks hauling fluids in the oilfield as well as frac tank rental. My job was to manage the day to day operations of the company as well as increase sales, securing MSA's with various customers. My task was to also write the company's HSE policies and procedures which are still followed to this day.
DOT and safety files were assembled and procedures put in place to keep the company within the guide lines of state and federal regulations. Together, with my team we implemented a sound safety program including ongoing training and making sure we ran under strict DOT guidelines. Within a few short weeks out revenue increased by 4-time s what the yard had been earning prior to my arrival.

• Area Manager Basic Energy Services

My job as Are a Manager for Basic Energy Service s is to take the assets under my control and generate revenue that in turn creates a profit margin that our shareholders demanded. My duties as Area Manager included over-sight of the human resource area, payroll and benefits, revenue entry and reporting under the Sarbanes-Oxley Compliance rules, as well as making sure all assets are utilized in a way that maximizes profit. Operating two fulltime maintenance facilities, maintain accurate records for D.O.T., OSHA and other state and federal agencies and their required reporting are also some of the many tasks that I managed and must answer for. My offices were responsible for the revenue entry, reconciliation of work performed, invoicing such work and collecting past due debt when needed. Basic allows each yard to operate independent from the rest and each yard controls the entire process with cooperate overseeing the operations. I supervise 37 drivers, 2 salesmen, 1 truck pusher, 3 mechanics, 3 dispatchers and 3 staff assistants.

V.P. of Safety/Human Resource for Azurite Service Company
(Azurite was acquired by Basic Energy Services)

Azurite Service Company was an oilfield service company operating in
East Texas and Barnett Shale (Cleburne) area. We had 6 yards, 6 disposals, 125 trucks, 800 frac tanks and employed close to 300 people. When I accepted the position as Director of Safety and HR Azurite had 8 comp claims, suffered 14 roll overs in the past 12 months including one fatality with no formal record keeping process in place to speak of. Within 90 days my team had completely rebuilt their DOT filing and record keeping process and then set up checks and balance s to keep records accurate. I then focused my attention to OSHA rules and regulations and HR tasks with emphasis on the hiring process. Within 6 months our HR process was working as required enabling the hiring of new employees at the yard level but ensuring all followed DOT, OSHA and other state and federal agencies. The 12 months after my being hired we had one rollover, one head on collision and closed 6 comp claims returning over $4 million in reserves back to the company.

I also began to build our safety program implementing weekly, monthly and yearly training. Certifying employees where required to by government or customer requirements. Help author their safety hand book including all required OSHA training along with industry specific training classes. I held meetings with potential customers selling our revamped safety program and reduced out TRIR significantly. In this position I supervised two safety professionals, one HR assistant and one DOT compliance clerk. I answered directly to the President.

Assistant Terminal Manager / Safety Coordinator for Arrow Trucking in Houston Texas.
Fleet Manager of 75 trucks for arrow trucking in Tulsa Oklahoma. Truck Pusher for Bayou Tank in Dew Texas. (Bayou Tank was acquired by Stallion)

I have approximately 40 collage hours in computer science and web authoring. I have extensive knowledge of all Microsoft Office applications such as Excel, Outlook, Database, Word, Power Point and Front Page. During my time in college I was added and remained on the dean's list for achieving a 4.0 GPA.

I was a police officer in Texas for several years with my last peace officer job as Chief of Police in Lott Texas. I worked in all aspects of law enforcement up to chief of police, supervising other officers in my department, hiring and terminating employees when certain conditions existed, and city policy warranted, implementing schedules, rules, regulations and department policies as well as administering a department budget. I work well with others and was well respected as a city official and friend."]
edu: [u'Certificate', u'Associate in Law Enforcement', u'50+ hours in Computer Science and network security', u'Many 1 to 5 day OSHA and DOT classes.']
